True (lit: made of truth), real, genuine. From alethes; truthful.

15.parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
15.str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

15.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
15.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

15.parse: Conjunction
15.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

15.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
15.str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.

15.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
15.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

15.parse: Adjective - Accusative Masculine Plural
15.str2: Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.

15.parse: Conjunction
15.str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

15.parse: Adjective - Accusative Neuter Plural
15.str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

15.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
15.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

15.parse: Preposition
15.str2: Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

15.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
15.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

15.parse: Noun - Genitive Masculine Singular
15.str2: Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

15.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
15.str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.

15.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
15.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
16.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

16.parse: Adverb
16.str2: No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

16.str2: To pick out for myself, choose, elect, select. Middle voice from ek and lego; to select.

16.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

16.str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

16.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

16.str2: To pick out for myself, choose, elect, select. Middle voice from ek and lego; to select.

16.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

16.str2: And, even, also, namely.

16.str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
16.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

16.parse: Conjunction
16.str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

16.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
16.str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.

16.str2: And, even, also, namely.

16.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
16.str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.

16.parse: Noun - Accusative Masculine Singular
16.str2: Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.

16.parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
16.str2: Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.

16.str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.

16.str2: Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

16.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

16.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

17.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
